headline: Garlic Prime Rib
description: A simple prime rib marinade made with olive oil, lots of garlic, black pepper, and thyme turns your prime rib roast into a restaurant-worthy meal.

video.description: See how to make the perfect Christmas roast.
video.name: Garlic Prime Rib

name: Garlic Prime Rib

recipeInstructions.text: Place roast in a roasting pan with the fatty side up. Mix garlic, olive oil, salt, pepper, and thyme together in a small bowl. Spread mixture over the top of roast; let roast sit out until it is at room temperature, no longer than 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).

Bake roast in the preheated oven for 30 minutes; reduce the temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C), and continue roasting for an additional 60 to 75 minutes. The internal temperature of the roast should be at 135 degrees F (57 degrees C) for medium rare.
Allow roast to rest for 10 or 15 minutes before carving so the meat can retain its juices.

review.reviewBody: People are so thick! Use a meat thermometer to watch your temps! This is a basic recipe not meant to mask the natural flavor of an expensive cut of meat. Just remember it will continue to cook another 5-7 degrees while it’s resting.
Not enough salt and cooking temp and time was way off. Cooked this way twice and both times the meat was raw and required further cooking.

This has been my go to recipe for a long long time. Bring your roast up to as close to room temp as possible. (A 2 bone roast will easily take longer than 1 hour, probably 3 hours to warm up to room temp). Use fresh garlic, more is better. Use kosher salt and lots of it. Use fresh cracked black pepper. Rest at 125-128 to reach a final internal temp of 135. If someone thinks that is too rare for them, get them to finish it to their liking on the grill. We make our own sourcream and horseradish sauce. Serve with Sky High Yorkshire.
Absolutely mouth watering!!
Very tasty, however; 135 was too rare and we opted for 145/150 to give a medium rare flavor.
I agree it's a basic recipe, but you don't need to get fancy with prime rib. This was my personal recipe as well. It's a good one. Just don't overcook your roast.
Such a simple yet perfect recipe for succulent Prime Rib. I'll have to remember this the next time I can afford a 10 lb. Prime Rib... What year is this? lol
No changes to food but brought to room temp adding another 40 min.. This is a GREAT recipe, been using for 10-12 years.

We tried to adjust recipe to a 6lb prime rib (500 degrees at 18 minutes, then 325 for 36 minutes) and it was pretty rare. We took it out of the oven at 127 degrees and let it rest. Flavor was excellent, but next time we'll leave it in a bit longer.
Amazing !
Love it. This is the only way I cook my prime rib
Absolutely THE BEST recipe for prime rib roast, hands down. Simple and easy to prepare and cook. For my family and friends, it has become a much anticipated holiday/special dinner tradition. Enjoy!

Absolutely love this recipe. I have made this maybe a dozen times... I always use a thermometer because the size of the rib has varied drastically. I would make it more often if I could afford to... I have reduced the salt because of a request by my better half.
The garlic on this burned and tasted terrible. Would never make it again, ruined a costly piece of prime rib.

Mine took longer to cook, I kept it out for almost an hour before baking, but it took an additional 75 minutes in the oven. Other than that this was an easy recipe. Love garlic so that was awesome. To those whose roast was raw, I’d say that’s what the meat thermometer is for!

I had a 12 pound roast. After 95 minutes of cooking (first 20 minutes at 500, the other 75 minutes at 325), the internal temperature of the roast was 95 degrees.... Oven temperature was accurate. How is anyone getting this to medium rare after 95 minutes?
We used this recipe on Christmas day, The rib turned out perfect. No alterations to recipe.

Wonderful recipe comes out perfect every time 10 lb 12 people perfect serving size. I have my local butcher leave rib on uncut, I cut them off once roast is done before slicing. Hint I do put a small amount (1tablespoon)of raw horseradish mix in with my crust seasoning!
Modified the recipe for 3.5 lb roast had to increase the amount of olive oil so I could spread on the roast.

This is amazing, I didnt change a thing. Was my first attempt of prime rib and decided to debut on Christmas and it came out perfect. The marinade is super versatile and I use it for tritip roast and brisket too, I just adjust the oven temperature and cooking times for the cut of meat I use. I don't have a picture of the prime rib since it was at Christmas but I make the tritip roast every so often and posted a picture of it. it comes juicy, flavorful, and melt in your mouth tender every single time! I usually marinate the tritip over night. thanks for sharing this gem

It was good, but I'm going for that 5-star taste
so I'll keep trying this one

I don’t honestly know what made this recipe different but it really was the best one I’ve made. We added more seasoning (just more, nothing additional) but other than that just followed the recipe which ended up pretty amazing, and French dips day after were great too.

Excellent recipe, simple and reliable! I added rosemary to the rub. It's also flexible, the meat remains flavorful even if you forget to put the rub an hour before cooking, just add before putting the meat into the oven and it will come out just as good.
We made this at Christmas(2020) This was the best meal we have ever had. Super delicious!

My family hated it. Hubby didn’t eat it, kid only ate cuz he was hungry. Made it exactly as recipe. Now, day later, put in pressure cooker with a whole bunch of spices. Have to find another recipe for the next prime rib.

Delish!!!!! Used another reviewers suggestion of doubling marinade and lowering initial temperature. Did 425° for 15 mins. Then 325° for about 15-20 mins per pound.. I had a 6lb roast. Undid the original roast twine and slather marinade between bone and roast. Retired roast. Made a very good gravy.

Perfection! Every bit as good as anything you’d get in the best restaurants! I got a prime rib on sale for 3.99 a pound. Had to jump on it! It was Choice, not prime. But I then dry aged it at home, trimmed it up today, followed this recipe exactly. Mine was a 3 rib roast, about half the weight, so cut everything in half on the ingredients.
Just the right amount of spices along with the 500 degree initial searing made this recipe a keeper. What a crust.

This was fantastic! It was my first time making prime rib, and this recipe was easy to follow and my family loved the results. I followed other suggestions and turned down the heat a notch and roasted until ~330 degrees. I also used a ~5lb roast, but the same amount of rub. Turned out perfect!

delish only thing i would do differently
to marinate the Rib overnight
it really had no flavor other than on the top

This was a great dinner! The only problem I had was that it took almost an hour longer than mentioned. I was making a 12 LB Roast, But I didn't think the time difference would have been that big of a change. However, It WAS AMAZING! The family loved it, and I am now adding this to my Holiday line up from now on.
This recipe is absolutely delicious. I have been making it for years and never did a review. I love garlic so I double for a 10-pound prime rib!
Soooooamazing

Really loved this one - my first prime rib! The rub is very very good. The only thing I would do differently is to use a thermometer - we like a little less red in our meat and I kind of eyeballed the time. It came out really great. I will definitely make this again but I with a meat thermometer to get it just right.
Absolutely perfect, this is the first time I have ever done prime rib myself and I fully admit I was nervous.

I coated the standing rib roast with a thin layer of mustard, some sea salt, and herbs. Followed the instructions of 5 minutes a pound at 500 degrees, and shut the oven off and waited 2 hours per the recipe. Let it rest for 15 minutes before slicing. Perfectly rare.

Perfection! We did a 5 lb er vs 10 so watched the time carefully, took out of oven when it reached 140 degrees. Let er sit for 10 which was sooooo hard at that point as we were hangry. It could not have been any better. Thank you for a super simple way of cooking that prime rib.
I made 2 ten lb roasts, for 11 people. OMG! Delicious! Everyone loved it and said it was perfect. So easy!
Perfect

The recipe is great, but wow are the times way off. We had a 7# roast, not 10#, and it took exactly 2 hours to get to 130 internally. And the last 30 minutes was at 350 rather than 325. We used 2 meat thermometers and measured oven temp so we are confident with the numbers.
I made this recipe last night. It was so good. Too bad the oven timer didn’t shut it off on time and it was more medium well than what Inlike
This was amazing! The flavor made it all the way through to the meat! This will be my go to recipe!
I've been making this prime rib roast recipe every year for Christmas, and I search it every year. Finally decided to review, save, and comment! Thank you for posting this!
I was intimidated to make my first Prome Rib
It was perfect!
I made this recipe, scaling it down for a roast that was just under 5 lb., and it turned out beautifully. We were very happy with it. Will definitely make it again.

Close. I would have pulled it at 125 F, let it rest to 130 F, then served. It was just a little over done at 130 F resting to 135 F.

Also, you gotta like garlic!
Easy Recipe! Perfect taste!

Easy peasy! This recipe is a no brainer. I made more of the marinade and slathered it all over the roast. I did the 500 for 20 min and it made a perfect crust. Turned it down to 325 ans roasted for 70 minutes. Perfect.

I used a 3 lb prime rib roast and followed the ingredient directions exactly. At 130° i turned the oven to 400° and made sure to baste every 20 mins. Cooking time was 80 mins and it turned out PERFECT!

We had a 5 lb prime rib. Basted it with the oil and seasonings (plus a few garlic in holes I put in the roast) the day before. Let it sit out for 3 hours before cooking it. Did it at 455 (everyone seemed divided between 450 and 460) for 12 minutes, then 400 for 8 min. Cooked at 325 for around 85 minutes till it was 135 internal. My husband swore it was the best he had ever had and to never cook another prime rib another way. Came out a perfect medium rare.
Hands down best roast recipe ever.

My daughter made this for us and it was EPIC! Best prime rib I've ever eaten, and that's a lot being as I was in the restaurant industry more than 50 years. 
 Thank you
This turned out fantastic! My 7 year old even asked for seconds. I followed the recipe to the T besides adding an extra clove of garlic and olive oil for spreading the dill/rosemary mixture.
I was not that happy with this recipe. A little bland. Will not use this again.

I rarely post on AR but use the app everyday for inspiring dishes. I was blown away making prime rib for the first time in my LIFE. Went by the recipe exactly except I had a 7.5 pounder and still used all of the garlic the recipe calls for. I let the marinade sit on the scored roast overnight and took it out an hour before roasting. Set the oven for 475 for the 1st half hour (to prevent a scorched crust) then dropped the temp to 325 roasting 15 min per pound. Took it out and let it sit for 30-40 min while I finished up my sides. It was better than any restaurant I’ve ever had ordered prime rib from. Made an au jus from the drippings (spooning off most of the grease in the pan first) Was a delicious (Quarantined) Easter dinner for my family of 7. Thanks for the recipe!
Delicious. Followed recipe 100%. Great!!

The prime rib was out standing!!! Only difference is is it cooked it 30 minutes 500° for my 8 pound prime rib and then I lowered the heat to 325 for 70 minutes and then I rested for 25 minutes covered delicious!!
The easiest and best tasting prime rib without the major sweating. My husband is never going to use any other recipe.
Yes I would make this again.

Made the recipe a exactly as indicated.
Very juicy excellent roast
This is just the PERFECT Prime Rib!! This will always be my "go to" Recipe for Prime Rib!! Family LOVED it!

Amazing. Followed the recipe exactly, adjusting cook time to suit my 4 lb. roast, while keeping the garlic topping as written for the big roast (we love garlic!). Added a generous splash of Cabernet and beef broth to the pan, along with a couple of roasted garlic cloves from another recipe, and the jus was fantastic. We will definitely make this again!
While the meat got good reviews the garlic burned and it smoked up the house a bit.

1. My 10# roast took an extra 90 minutes with these cooking directions. I used regular and digital thermometers and check every 15 minutes. I was not going to ruin a $150 cut of meat. 

2. I also used 15 large garlic cloves. 

3. Rested the meat about 25 minutes

"Spread the mixture over the fatty layer of the roast, and let the roast sit out until it is at room temperature, no longer than 1 hour."

This was supposed to be our New Years Day dinner. Thank goodness it wasn't for company I would have been total embarrassed.

Following the instruction as written "Let the roast sit out until room temperature , no LONGER THAN 1 HOUR. Well, we planned on a 6:30 dinner the roast was not cooked until 8:30 because 1 hour at room temperature was not enough to bring it to room temperature.

We had salami sandwiches for dinner. Our beautiful Prime Rib will not be eaten until Friday.

Amazing prime rib!! This is my husbands favorite meal and he said it was the best ever!! I read the reviews and also started with the oven heat at 450 degrees for 30 minutes and then 325 degrees for 13-15 lbs per lbs and then at end took out of oven and tented the roast with aluminum foil and let it sit until the thermometer reached 135 degrees for medium rare roast.
Prime rib turned out perfect!! So simple and easy!! Looking forward to making it again!

Absolutely delicious!! I was scared to make because expensive cut of meat to buy and just ruin BUT OMG it was soo good!!!! I didn't have thyme either so I thought it'd be missing some flavor and omg no!! I did buy a smaller one at 4.5 lb so I followed another recipe where they adjusted the temp to the smaller cut and it came out PERFECT!!!

This recipe is way off on the timing. It took way longer than the allotted time and I ended up serving dinner later than expected. And yes, I had it out of the fridge for a couple of hours before cooking it. However, the flavor was really good.
Pure bliss! My husband loves a good prime rib and this was my first attempt. It was a complete success!
Did exactly what the recipe called for and it turned out perfect
Amazing!!!
Perfect just the way it was! Didn't make any changes.
Delicious. Easy. Made it for Christmas. Everyone one loved it
Cake out fantastic delicious
Totally AWESOME!!!! First time Ive ever made it!! I think it will be my GO TO Christmas dinner from now on!

I have always been afraid to try my hand at Prime Rib- until it was on sale! I had a 4.5lb roast and as I read the comments I adjusted the times accordingly but left the measurements for the crust alone-this was amazingly easy and so yummy! I’m looking forward to making it again and sharing with friends/family!
Loved it! This is the perfect prime rib! Make this every Christmas now! Must have with creamy horseradish sauce!

Super easy but so impressive to serve. Used a 14 lb boneless prime rib and it was cooked to perfection with medium pieces at either end blending to medium rare to rare in the middle. Zero leftovers. Served with popovers and roasted winter root veggies. Incredible holiday meal!

Best prime rib I've ever made. So good in fact I went back to the store to buy another one while they are still on sale. Now making the 2nd one in a week's time. PS the leftovers made incredible French dip sandwiches
Excellent. Made it with no changes.
Absolutely delicious, especially with the mushroom glaze, brussel sprouts, and traaeger potatoes!

The directions were spot on. I suggest a very good oven thermometer and a probe style stick thermometer for the meat. It pays to be sure of the temps, and to check after each hour. I used two 6.5 lb roasts with the bone in and roasted it bone side down, covered with foil.

We really liked the topping for the rib. I followed the directions and at 500 for 20 minutes then lowered to 325. Two and a half hours later it still was not done. We ended up just taking out of oven and microwaving for those who wanted a rib that was not rare.

I think I undercooked this a little -- my meat thermometer lost its battery. Nothing a few seconds in the microwave couldn't fix. One of my guests loved the rareness so I let him have those. This was so tender and flavorful, and I didn't even use a prime cut, I had a select cut. The crispy rub was absolutely to die for. I was a little nervous about making this, as I've never cooked this cut of meat before, but it was amazing. Bought a 5.5 lb and not much was left over.
Will make it again. Mine was only 6 lbs. I added Rosemary with the Thyme and adjusted cooking time. It was delicious.

Chef John vs Chef Mike- last year I did chef John's method of turning oven off it was great! This year I Did chef Mike's version and it was REALLY GREAT! Idk why? I did get more of a crust by keeping the oven on? Delicious! I do have 15 + year old oven? So that could be why leaving the oven on made it better? Way more flavor keeping oven on. No photo I ate it ALL
I followed this recipe but also put a layer of carrots and onions in the roasting pan for the roast to sit on.... very easy and everyone loved it.
Just switched the salt to kosher salt. And sometimes it is cooked on my webber grill.
The most perfect prime rib I have cooked. 5.03 lbs cooked for 25 minutes at 500 deg.; oven turned off and left undisturbed for two hours. Came out absolutely perfect!
My family loves it.
I have made this for the last several years for Christmas Eve dinner. So easy and you don't have to be in the kitchen the whole holiday! My family loves it!

Though I stress out every year over making prime rib for Christmas dinner, the roast turns out perfect every year. On occasion I have suggested doing something else for Christmas, but the family and extended family loudly disagree. Great recipe!
Perfect!
Turned out perfect!
put rub on for an extra day. It turned out just as we hoped.

I followed the recipe exactly except that I only used 5 lbs of meat. It DID NOT take and additional 70 minutes to cook. It took me another 3.5 hours to get a temperature of 135. Once done, I waited 15 minutes before carving. Aside from the outside of the meat, the inside was absolutely tasteless. No taste of garlic, salt, thyme, blackpepper.
was great pulled it out at 125 degrees. After resting it was a little over done. I like mine rare to medium rare. it was a perfect medium.
